questions.question: What does frictional loss in a pipe primarily depend on?

answers.b: Length and roughness of the pipe

explanations.a: Fluid type matters, but pipe length and roughness are more critical.
explanations.b: Correct! These physical properties directly influence friction losses.
explanations.c: Color has no impact on fluid dynamics.
explanations.d: Sunlight does not affect internal pipe friction.

questions.question: Which of the following flow regimes is most associated with significant friction losses?

explanations.a: A static fluid does not flow and hence has no friction loss.
explanations.b: Laminar flow has lower friction losses compared to turbulent.
explanations.c: Correct! Turbulent flow results in higher friction losses.
explanations.d: Supersonic flow is not typically studied in simple pipe flow scenarios.

questions.question: What does the Reynolds number indicate in pipe flow?

answers.a: The chemical composition of the fluid
answers.b: The speed of sound in the fluid
answers.c: Whether the flow is laminar or turbulent
answers.d: The temperature gradient in the pipe

explanations.a: Reynolds number does not describe chemical composition.
explanations.c: Correct! It predicts the flow regime.

questions.question: If the flow rate increases in a pipe, what generally happens to the friction loss?

explanations.a: More flow causes more energy loss due to friction.
explanations.b: Friction loss varies with flow conditions.
explanations.c: Correct! More flow leads to greater losses.
explanations.d: Friction loss never becomes zero during flow.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the head loss in a straight pipe due to friction?

answers.b: A pressure drop along the length of the pipe
answers.c: A thermal reaction inside the fluid

explanations.a: Friction causes energy loss, not gain.
explanations.b: Correct! Friction leads to a pressure drop, called head loss.
explanations.c: No significant thermal reaction is involved.
explanations.d: Pipe diameter may influence friction but is not the result of it.
